title: The Street
description: A Houghton Mifflin Literary Fellowship Novel - Taken from back cover: The Street is the poignant and unblinkingly honest story of Lutie Johnson, a young black woman, and her struggle to live and raise a son amid the violence poverty and racial dissonance of Harlem in the late 1940s. The Street was Ann Petry's first novel, a best seller with more than a million and half copies in print.
author: Ann Petry
